result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon Mack Guillory

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ramon Mack Guillory appeared by video, in custody at MCJ.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Ramon Mack Guillory.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:00 p.m.
Court also calls 22TR1095, 22TR1096, 22TR1097, 22TR1098.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Parties ready to proceed to Arraignment. 
Information tracks Amended Complaint.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests STC.
3:06 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Ramon Mack Guillory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Spansail in court for Ramon Mack Guillory.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Requests prelim within time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
9:33 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Order For Defendant To Abstain From Alcohol And For Testing

1:45 PM Defendant Ramon Mack Guillory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22cf199, and 22tr1095 - 1098.
Atty Brad Hansen is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Hansens heard - has reviewed charges with Deft and Deft understands.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no operate a motor vehicle without a valid license, no entry into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, compliance with Soberlink.
Court allows Deft to reside at 324 7th St in Menominee if release on bond. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
1:53 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
